page.title: 01Rural Mid Suffolk
page.content:
The area is predominantly flat and open arable land. Most of the land lies a few metres above the 61 meter countour line. Soil heavy, fertile and is drained through clay and plastic pipe into the ditches. A lot of hedges and trees have been grubbed out tomake larger fields. These often come to the edge of the roads. Many ditches still have hedges and trees along them. There ae also spinneys and small woods. New trees and hedges are being planted. The area is totally agricultural and many residents are engaged in farming and its service industries. People however with no connection with agriculture now live in the area and many of them work in Bury St Edmunds.
The hamlets have few amenities, though they have had new houses added to them
